snippet: In a March 11 special election, David Jolly will now face Alex Sink, a well-known Democrat who narrowly lost to Gov. Rick Scott and is considered the front-runner.
abstract: First race in 2014 battle for Congress takes shape as David Jolly defeats two opponents to win Republican primary for seat in Florida that was held by late C W Bill Young; Jolly will now face Alex Sink in special election; Sink is well-known Democrat who narrowly lost to Gov Rick Scott and is considered front-runner.

byline.contributor: Marilyn Garateix contributed reporting from Largo, Fla.

lead_paragraph: In a March 11 special election, David Jolly will now face Alex Sink, a well-known Democrat who narrowly lost to Gov. Rick Scott and is considered the front-runner.

headline.main: Aide to Late Lawmaker Wins a House Primary in Florida
headline.print_headline: Aide to Late Lawmaker Wins A House Primary in Florida
